result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:34 AM Defendant Jose J. Ruelas in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Jose J. Ruelas.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Activity: arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose J. Ruelas
Current: 1317 Broad St, Beloit, WI 53511 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: 2080 Shopiere Rd Apt 8N, Beloit, WI 53511 United States

01:51 PM Defendant Jose J. Ruelas in court appearing by video with attorney Philip J. Brehm appearing by video .  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address updated.  Information filed, copy to defendant, not guilty plea entered by attorney, jury trial to be set. Remand to branch 7 for scheduling.

02:34 PM Defendant Jose J. Ruelas in court by video with attorney Philip J. Brehm by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:17 AM and recalled at 8:28 AM Defendant Jose J Ruelas in court in person in courtroom with attorney Philip J. Brehm in person in courtroom. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address updated. Signature bond set of $750.00 with conditions: Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond today while in courthouse. Matter continued to follow 21CF537 per request of attorney Brehm. Preliminary hearing not requested yet. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 2:30PM.
